collection.title: Frames
collection.description: Audiovisual materials are made up of frames – both in video, where frames are a series of images, and in audio, where frames are a series of samples.

childMarkdownRemark.excerpt:
Aspect ratios determine the width and height of an image and how it should be displayed. The
aspect ratio dimensions are commonly expressed…

Video files also have sampling rates, but are more frequently characterized by their frame rates.
Frame rates determine how fast things go…
Audio files are composed of samples. Samples are values at a specific point in time. Audio is often described by its sampling rate…
Interlacing is for optimizing perceived motion in lossy video material. They can be more commonly identified as “annoying squiggly lines…
